entries.description: List of works of culinary literature to extract from text. If no works are found, return an empty array. Each item must follow the structure below.

title_original.description: Full title exactly as printed in the historical source (preserve spelling, capitalization, and diacritics). Use null only if no title is present in the input.

title_modern_english.description: Normalized modern English title intended for linkage and downstream matching. Translate or standardize the title if customary; otherwise repeat the original title. Use null only if truly unknown.

short_title.description: Concise reference form (e.g., common short title or siglum). Aim for ≤ 100 characters. Use null if no clear short form exists.

description.description: 1–3 sentences summarizing the work’s historical significance or distinctive features (neutral, factual). Use null if the input provides no summary.

contributors.description: People credited for the work. Include each contributor once with their role. Preserve historical spelling and provide a modern English form for linkage.

name_original.description: Contributor’s name exactly as given in the source (preserve spelling and diacritics).

name_modern_english.description: Modern English or standardized form of the contributor’s name for linkage. If not applicable, repeat the original.

role.description: Contributor’s function with respect to the work. If uncertain, choose Unknown; if not listed, choose Other. Do not use null unless the role is missing in the input.

languages.description: Languages in which the work is written (across editions if relevant). Use the provided controlled vocabulary; if not listed, choose Other.

items.description: One language value from the controlled list.

genre.description: Select the single best-fitting genre from the controlled list. Use Other when none fits. Do not use null unless the genre is not stated in the input.

culinary_focus.description: Topical emphases of the work. Select one or more values from the controlled list; use Other for topics not listed; use Unknown only when the input is ambiguous.

items.description: One topical focus value from the controlled list.

edition_years.description: All known publication or edition years as integers when available. Use null for uncertain or unspecified years.

items.description: Four-digit Gregorian year (e.g., 1549) or null when unknown.

publication_places.description: Places of publication. Use the standardized place object and provide both original and modern English names.

name_original.description: Place name as given in the source (preserve spelling and diacritics).

name_modern_english.description: Modern English equivalent of the place name for linkage (e.g., Venezia → Venice).

place_type.description: Select the best-fitting category for the place.

country_modern.description: Modern country name in English (e.g., Italy; France). Avoid ISO codes.

associated_places.description: Places associated with the work’s content, circulation, or influence. Use the same standardized place object.

name_original.description: Place name as recorded in the cited source (preserve spelling).

name_modern_english.description: Modern English place name used for linkage and geocoding.

place_type.description: Select the best-fitting category for the associated place.

country_modern.description: Modern country name in English (e.g., Spain; Germany).

period.description: Temporal coverage of the work (first appearance, compilation period, or known range in which it was produced/published). Use nulls for unknown boundaries and use notation for textual hints.

start_year.description: Earliest relevant year (four-digit Gregorian). Use null if unknown.

end_year.description: Latest relevant year (four-digit Gregorian). Use null if unknown.

sources.description: Secondary sources supporting the extracted data for this work.

pages.description: Exact page(s) or section (e.g., 'pp. 40–45'; 'ch. 2'); use null if not specified.

quotation.description: Short supporting quote (≤ 500 characters) if the input provides one; otherwise null.

links.description: Lightweight cross-references to related entities using labels (no identifiers).

label_original.description: Exact label of the referenced entity as it appears in the source.

label_modern_english.description: Modern English label for the referenced entity for linkage.

relationship.description: Nature of the relationship to the referenced entity (choose the closest match).
